intro: Diplolaena salicifolia var. revoluta, commonly known as the silky leaf diplolaena, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. The flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in spikes, and bloom during the spring and summer months. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for garden planting in temperate climates.
